intro: Mesomelaena uncinata, commonly known as the hooked mesomelaena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Mesomelaena uncinata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
